awd_titl_txt: A Workshop on the Numerical Solution of Markov Chains,      North Carolina State University, Raleigh, North Carolina
awd_abstract_narration: This grant supported a workshop on Numerical Solution   of Markov Chains.  The  area  is of current high research activity and wide   applicability.  The workshop  brought together three  groups of researchers working in this   field:  applied probabilists, numerical analysts, and system    engineers.  The goals of  the workshop included:    - To foster co-operation among diverse researchers, to   minimize  unnecessary duplication and to identify new long-  term research objectives.   - To bring up-to-date and to inform researchers who work in   branch of this area, the work being undertaken in  different   areas.   - To produce a comprehensive set of proceedings that will   become a significant reference work.   - To launch a repository of numerical examples that arise in  Markov chain  applications, and to couple it with sparse   matrix manipulation  procedures and well-tested and robust  numerical solution   methods.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division of Computing and Communication Foundations
